00001 <h2>Instructions</h2>
00002 <p>
00003         When you launch MiniBatteryLogger, it starts monitoring your laptop battery.
00004         The default view is the chart of the charge and amperage over time. Anyway,
00005         you will have to wait some time to see interesting stuff ;)
00006 </p>
00007 <p class="centered">
00008         <img src="/assets/images/software/<?php echo $this->software->type; ?>/<?php echo $this->software->name; ?>/chartview.png" alt="The Chart View" />
00009 </p>
00010 <p>
00011         The chart view shows a graph of the charge of the battery and its amperage 
00012         versus time. Additionally,
00013         a bubble icon will mark each power event: a change of power source, the 
00014         beginning and end of charge, sleep and wakeup.
00015 </p>
00016 <p class="centered">
00017         <img src="/assets/images/software/<?php echo $this->software->type; ?>/<?php echo $this->software->name; ?>/sessionbrowser.png" alt="The Sessions Browser" />
00018 </p>
00019 <p>
00020         Monitoring sessions can be saved to disk for later analysis &mdash; by default, automatically.
00021         To manage past sessions, use the Sessions Browser, provided as a drawer.
00022         You can visualize a session just clicking on it, while the application will
00023         continue monitoring the battery in the background.
00024 </p>
00025 <p>
00026         The Battery Inspector shows you all the available details about your battery:
00027         charge, amperage, voltage, capacity &mdash; current and maximum &mdash; time
00028         to empty when on battery power and time to full when charging; number of full
00029         cycles. Did I forget something? ;)
00030 </p>
00031 <p class="centered">
00032         <img src="/assets/images/software/<?php echo $this->software->type; ?>/<?php echo $this->software->name; ?>/inspector.png" alt="The Battery Inspector" />
00033 </p>
00034 <p>
00035         By default, the application changes its Dock icon to reflect the status of
00036         the battery.
00037         Five different colors from green to red when you&rsquo;re running on battery
00038         power, depending on the remaining
00039         charge, and two other blue icons when charging or plugged to AC power.
00040 </p>
00041 <p>
00042         It is not as colorful as
00043         <a href="/software/widgets/minibatterystatus/">MiniBatteryStatus widget</a>,
00044         but it&rsquo;s still
00045         a gorgeous sight. Isn&rsquo;t it nice?
00046 </p>
00047 <p class="centered">
00048         <img src="/assets/images/software/<?php echo $this->software->type; ?>/<?php echo $this->software->name; ?>/dock-statusicon.png" alt="Battery Status as Dock icon" />
00049 </p>
00050 
00051 <h3>Statistics</h3>
00052 <p class="centered">
00053         <img src="/assets/images/software/<?php echo $this->software->type; ?>/<?php echo $this->software->name; ?>/statsview.png" alt="The Statistics View" />
00054 </p>
00055 <p>
00056         MiniBatteryLogger keeps a record of your battery health stats. Every time
00057         the cycle count increases or the maximum capacity decreases, MiniBatteryLogger
00058         saves a <strong>&ldquo;snapshot&rdquo;</strong>, with date and an optional
00059         user comment &mdash; you can also create and delete snapshots manually, of course.
00060 </p>
00061 <p>
00062         Snapshots let you evaluate the evolution of your battery performance along
00063         time, to detect malfunctioning or estimate the remaining battery life.
00064         &mdash; <em class="lighter">maybe when I&rsquo;ll be sponsored by Apple I&rsquo;ll
00065         add an alert to suggest the purchase of a new battery!! ;)</em>
00066 </p>
00067 
00068 <h3>Comparison</h3>
00069 <p class="centered">
00070         <img src="/assets/images/software/<?php echo $this->software->type; ?>/<?php echo $this->software->name; ?>/compview.png" alt="The Comparison View" />
00071 </p>
00072 <p>
00073         Have you ever wondered how good is your battery compared to the others?
00074         Now with MiniBatteryLogger&rsquo;s comparison tools you can compare your
00075         battery with all the other users&rsquo; batteries. The Shared Battery Data
00076         Archive is also accessible through a nice
00077         <a href="http://burgos.emeraldion.it/mbl/">web interface</a>.
00078 </p>
00079 <p>
00080         Battery data is collected <em>anonymously</em> by computer model.
00081         Additionally, you can set the
00082         date of purchase of the battery to help the system to elaborate statistics
00083         based on the age of batteries. Please don&rsquo;t cheat! ;)
00084 </p>
00085 
00086 <h3>The Battery Log</h3>
00087 <p class="centered">
00088         <img src="/assets/images/software/<?php echo $this->software->type; ?>/<?php echo $this->software->name; ?>/logview.png" alt="The Log View" />
00089 </p>
00090 <p>
00091         MiniBatteryLogger logs to disk all relevant battery and power source events.
00092         The Log View shows the current log from the start of the current session.
00093         Every time an event is caught, a line is appended to the log. A search field
00094         lets you filter the lines of interest (e.g. when you&rsquo;re just searching
00095         for the power chord disconnections, type &ldquo;battery power&rdquo;).
00096 </p>
00097 
00098 
00099 <h3>Preferences</h3>
00100 <p>
00101         Every user has different needs. MiniBatteryLogger lets you customize about
00102         every parameter involved in monitoring the battery and report of data.
00103 </p>
00104 <p class="centered">
00105         <img src="/assets/images/software/<?php echo $this->software->type; ?>/<?php echo $this->software->name; ?>/preferences-general.png" alt="General Preferences" />
00106 </p>
00107 <p>
00108         The <strong>General</strong> pane lets you choose the time interval of active
00109         battery polling and to enable or disable the visualization of the battery status
00110         in the application&rsquo;s Dock icon.
00111 </p>
00112 <p class="centered">
00113         <img src="/assets/images/software/<?php echo $this->software->type; ?>/<?php echo $this->software->name; ?>/preferences-chartview.png" alt="Chart View Preferences" />
00114 </p>
00115 <p>
00116         The <strong>Chart View</strong> pane lets you choose the colors to be used in
00117         the graph of charge over time.
00118 </p>
00119 
00120 <p class="centered">
00121         <img src="/assets/images/software/<?php echo $this->software->type; ?>/<?php echo $this->software->name; ?>/preferences-notifications.png" alt="Notifications Preferences" />
00122 </p>
00123 <p>
00124         From the <strong>Alerts</strong> pane you can customize the way MiniBatteryLogger
00125         warns you about critical events. You can choose the level of charge under which the
00126         application should issue a Low Battery notification, and the level of capacity
00127         under which a Battery Near Death warning should be issued.
00128 </p>
00129 
00130 <p class="centered">
00131         <img src="/assets/images/software/<?php echo $this->software->type; ?>/<?php echo $this->software->name; ?>/preferences-swupdate.png" alt="Software Update Preferences" />
00132 </p>
00133 <p>
00134         The <strong>Software Update</strong> pane lets you enable the automatic update check
00135         at startup. You can also see when the last update check has been performed.
00136         An additional button lets you immediately check if there is an available update.
00137 </p>
00138 
00139 <p class="centered">
00140         <img src="/assets/images/software/<?php echo $this->software->type; ?>/<?php echo $this->software->name; ?>/preferences-sharing.png" alt="Sharing Preferences" />
00141 </p>
00142 <p>
00143         Finally, the <strong>Sharing</strong> pane lets you configure the way
00144         MiniBatteryLogger will interact with the world. From the <strong>Shared Battery Data
00145         Archive settings</strong> box you can set up MiniBatteryLogger to automatically send
00146         your own data to the archive and retrieve shared data on your computer model.
00147 </p>
00148 <p>
00149         From the <strong>Data Sharing settings</strong> box you can set up MiniBatteryLogger
00150         to look for shared battery data and to share your own data over the network.
00151         You may also decide not to advertise the service with Bonjour or to require a 
00152         password to access your data (not implemented).
00153 </p>
